hook:
THE GAP BETWEEN IDEA AND PRODUCTION JUST GOT SMALLER.

This week, we merged 40 PRs to turn Pollinations into a full multimedia engine.
body:
It is not just about image generation anymore. We are building the open-source infrastructure for the entire creative stack.

Here is what shipped this week:

1. FULL A/V CAPABILITIES
We integrated LTX-2 for video generation and ElevenMusic for high-fidelity audio. You can now generate a video, score it with AI music, and transcribe the dialogue via OVH Whisper — all within the same ecosystem.

2. OPEN SOURCE MOMENTUM
We open-sourced the code for our Polly Discord Bot (#8078). If you are building community tools, the blueprint is now yours to fork and modify.

3. SIMPLIFIED DX
We merged our Documentation directly into the Play page. No more tab switching. You see the model, you test the prompt, you get the API code instantly.

4. INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES
From upgrading to Claude Opus 4.6 on Bedrock to fixing single-bucket balance deductions, the backend is faster and more reliable.

Why this matters:
We are seeing developers move from single-modal apps (just images) to complex, multi-modal experiences. Our job is to make sure the infrastructure keeps up with their imagination.

We build in the open so you can build without limits.
cta: Test the new LTX-2 and ElevenMusic models right now on the Play page: pollinations.ai
